abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Tocantins
            Sustainable Regional Development Project is to contribute to
            raising living standards and to reducing inequalities and
            regional disparities in Brazil by improving access to
            markets, job opportunities, infrastructure and social
            services for rural communities in Tocantins' poorest
            regions, while ensuring sustainable use of natural resources
            and the protection of fragile ecosystems. The project is
            comprised of three components.  The participatory planning
            and management of regional and municipal development
            component will establish or strengthen mechanisms for local
            civil society participation; set up regional units of
            SEPLAN; and strengthen capacity to undertake multisectoral
            state-level planning, to administer public programs, and
            monitor/evaluate the performance of such programs. The
            environmental management component will: strengthen land
            management capacity; consolidate the environmental
            protection system; and support the regulation and promotion
            of sustainable land use.  The rural transport improvement
            component will: (a) strengthen road management capacity, by
            ensuring the preparation, monitoring and evaluation of
            efficient state road programs, and gradually increasing the
            road maintenance capacity; (b) define and improve about
            6,000 km of priority road sections of the main municipal
            road networks and improve about 120 km of high-priority
            state feeder roads including reconstruction of bridges and
            culverts, rehabilitation of road surfaces and bases, and
            paving; (c) promote cost-effective rural transport services,
            particularly school bus systems, and establish mechanisms to
            improve access of the rural poor to such services; and (d)
            provide support to the project coordination unit.
